definition: rumor
popular ballad/rumor
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: She is rumoured to have eloped with a priest.
sentences.chinese: 謠傳他和一個牧師私奔了。

sentences.english: In fact the rumor is without foundation.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，這個謠傳沒有根據。

sentences.english: The pay was not as much as was rumored, Huang said.
sentences.chinese: 黃說，薪水並沒有謠傳的那麼高。

sentences.english: There were rumours starting, from theIsraelites.
sentences.chinese: 以色列軍開始互相謠傳。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, you are OK also these message regard as bru it or it is gossip.
sentences.chinese: 不過，你也可以將這些消息看做謠傳或是道聽途說。

sentences.english: Bill Gates is rumored to be an Aspie.
sentences.chinese: 謠傳比爾蓋茨就是個亞斯伯格症患者。

sentences.english: It is rumored that this old house is home to a number of long-haired ghosts.
sentences.chinese: 謠傳這棟古宅是一些長髮鬼聚集的地方。

sentences.english: Rumour has it that something roars at the night in this house.
sentences.chinese: 據謠傳這所房間每天夜裏有什麼東西吼叫。

sentences.english: Rumor spread the prices would go up, many peopel stampeded into a wave of panic buying.
sentences.chinese: 謠傳物價要上漲，很多人捲入了搶購的風潮中。

sentences.english: There has been a bunch of blathering about Wikileaks in the last few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 過去幾周對“危機解密”有很多謠傳。

sentences.english: Rumors of an Apple netbook and/or a touchscreen Apple notebook have been bandied about for what seems like ages.
sentences.chinese: 蘋果上網本，或者帶觸摸屏的筆記本已經謠傳了很久。

sentences.english: She is rumoured to have been married in England.
sentences.chinese: 謠傳她已經在英國結婚。

sentences.english: Or the latest rumored release date of…
sentences.chinese: 竣工日期也可能是最近謠傳的某年月日。

sentences.english: As rumored, the film includes a brief sequence with dinosaurs.
sentences.chinese: 謠傳電影中將有恐龍的短暫戲份。

sentences.english: War rumours have caused [started] a panic.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭的謠傳已引起恐慌。

sentences.english: CONFIRM】The rumor that there was flooding was confirmed by a news broadcast.
sentences.chinese: 洪水的謠傳已被新聞廣播所證實。

definition: gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to change one's mind/to go back on one's word
widely spread/widely rumored/stories abound/(sb's exploits are) widely circulated
secret meeting/to meet secretly
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to quote out of context (idiom)
to vanish/to disappear from the face of the earth
two-China (policy)
to start a rumor
to set a trap
talent show/talent competition
unexpected/staggering (news) etc)
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
Yangdong county in Yangjiang 陽江|阳江[Yang2 jiang1], Guangdong
